key_points: CNN defended Chris Cuomo after allegations of preferential COVID-19 testing facilitated by his brother, former NY Governor Andrew Cuomo.
CNN's statement mentioned Chris Cuomo acted as any person would, seeking help during the early, uncertain days of the pandemic.
Chris Cuomo, a prime-time CNN host, has not personally commented on the allegations.
The controversy arose amid broader crises for Andrew Cuomo, including sexual harassment claims and criticism over handling of COVID-19 in nursing homes.
Chris Cuomo faced criticism for not providing rigorous journalistic scrutiny in interviews with his brother during the pandemic.
Chris Cuomo announced on March 31, 2020, he tested positive for COVID-19 but did not disclose how he obtained the test.
An Albany Times-Union report detailed that Andrew Cuomo and Health Commissioner Howard Zucker arranged prioritized testing for Cuomo's family.
Cuomo family members received multiple home visits for testing, with their samples fast-tracked for results.
Tests were scarce for the general public at this early stage of the pandemic.
The governor's office denied favoritism, claiming assistance was also provided to the general public, including legislators and reporters.
